description: Winner-side code for any decisive result
notes: Opposing side will have a corresponding loss code

description: Generic loser-side code used in some contexts
notes: Sometimes used instead of a specific reason on the losing side
Draw if opponent has insufficient material is handled by timevsinsufficient on the other side
Typically due to disconnect or leaving

description: Draw: one side timed out while the other had insufficient mating material
notes: Applied to the side that did not time out

description: Loss because your partner lost on the linked board
notes: Loser-side only; winner shows 'win'. Indicates other board caused end (not this board)

description: Loss because opponent's king reached the central hill
notes: Variant-specific: King of the Hill only

description: Loss because opponent delivered the third check
Winner when achieving the hill condition
Winner when delivering the third check
Winner (could be from this board or partner board)
notes: Do not infer partner loss from a win. Check loser: bughousepartnerlose ⇒ other board; resigned/checkmated ⇒ this board

description: Loss on this board by checkmate
notes: Not partner-loss; loser shows 'checkmated', winner shows 'win'

description: Loss on this board by resignation
notes: Not partner-loss; loser shows 'resigned', winner shows 'win'
